title: My show.
content:
Thought I’d post a pic of my senior show. Went fairly well ( a couple people understood )

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408045626im_/http:/typophile.com/files/124572591_0de6c464ea.jpg)

 [‹ Any Bulgarian speakers around?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408045626/http:/typophile.com/node/19346 "Go to previous forum topic") [normal v book ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408045626/http:/typophile.com/node/19327 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Eric_West

comments.content: Yes, more pictures - especially close ups so that Dan can criticize your spacing ;-)

Oh, I looked there already.

More!
What program are you graduating from?

Here’s two more,one with my lc y sliced finger, I’ve gotta go back and take some better photos with a tripod.

ps. jselig \_ I go to Northern Kentucky University. I heard I’m the first to do this tho.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408045626im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_0718.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408045626im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cutty.jpg)

RE: Finger  
The idea that you have to suffer for your art refers to the psyche…

Really nice work by the way.

peace

The finger is what you call cutting edge typgraphy :-)

ChrisL
Every designer has cut themselves 1,000 times on an exacto. It’s a rite of passage, a rotten one, but one none the less.

Ahhh...blood sacrifice :^) Sign of the rubricator—-what with all that there red felt on the wall an’ stuff.

The italic looks very promising. Keep it going.

j a m e s

thanks everyone,

i too believe the italic to be the strongest element, then the UC, then lastly the lc roman. I well def. keep working on this. Maybe after a brief vacation. But, I have officially determined that I am an addict, and will not be able to stop the type.

My name is Chris and I am a Typaholic...

ChrisL

We admitted we were powerless over glyphs—and thanks to OSX our fonts had become unmanageable…

The first step is the hardest.

peace

I just put some more pic’s up on my flickr. acct.  
 [http://flickr.com/photos/39436506@N00/sets/423589/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408045626/http:/flickr.com/photos/39436506@N00/sets/423589/ "http://flickr.com/photos/39436506@N00/sets/423589/")
Eric, I really like what you did for your exhibition. Now that school is over, what are you going to do next? I hope that you find the time to finish & expand your typeface.
Well, schools ALMOST over, probably soon tho. Def. going to keep working on it. I’m really only about 30-35 percent satisfied with it as it stands.
